message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We utilized the World Development Indicators dataset and the Global Findex database to analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the Demographic Health Survey and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey to explore the impact of climate change on child nutrition in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic Health Survey", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using the World Bank Enterprise Surveys, we investigate the effect of public-private partnerships on firm growth in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the relationship between governance, particularly regulatory quality, and competitiveness using data from the Worldwide Governance Indicators and the World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report.", "dataset": ["Worldwide Governance Indicators", "World Economic Forum's Global Competitiveness Report"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Exploiting rich panel data on job search behavior from the Tanzanian Labor Force Survey, we examine how social networks affect labor market outcomes of youth in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Tanzanian Labor Force Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset of extractive industries concessions in Peru and Bolivia, along with satellite imagery data, to analyze the impact of mining on forest cover loss in the region.", "dataset": ["extractive industries concessions in Peru and Bolivia", "satellite imagery data"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This paper investigates the impact of disaster risk management policies on economic growth in developing countries, using data from the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction and World Bank Development Indicators.", "dataset": ["Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction", "World Bank Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between transportation infrastructure, tourism development, and economic growth by combining datasets on airport traffic volumes, tourist arrivals, and GDP per capita from multiple sources.", "dataset": ["airport traffic volumes", "tourist arrivals", "GDP per capita"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Tourism", "Economic Growth"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the Education Management Information System and the Early Childhood Care and Development Profiles to assess the impact of early childhood education on later academic achievement in Uganda.", "dataset": ["Education Management Information System", "Early Childhood Care and Development Profiles"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "To better understand the relationship between water scarcity and inequality, we combine satellite-based estimates of water availability with household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and Living Standards Measurement Studies.", "dataset": ["satellite-based estimates of water availability", "Demographic and Health Surveys", "Living Standards Measurement Studies"], "topic": ["Water", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We utilized the World Development Indicators dataset and the Global Findex database to analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty reduction.", "dataset": Surveys", "Living Standards Measurement Studies"], "topic": ["Water", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
